info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 9:02PM PST until December 27 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS BEEN UPGRADED... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Above 1500 feet, heavy snow accumulations of 6 to 15 inches, and locally higher amounts up to 25 inches. Below 1500 feet, accumulating snow of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...All of Eastern Douglas County Foothills and Jackson County, including Medford, Ashland, Gold Hill, Rogue River, Jacksonville, Applegate, Steamboat, and Toketee Falls. Significant impacts are expected for all area roads and highways. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel and the Monday morning commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
